item.title: The Straussian take

Michael P Gibson on Twitter

‚ÄúV. much enjoyed Talent by @tylercowen & @danielgross Ostensibly the book offers tips for spotting talent. But the book is really about: Straussian take (1): the world is overwhelmingly made up of fakes and the robotic. Good luck Straussian (2): In fact you are fake and robotic‚Äù

item.title: Seven Varieties of Stupidity
item.description:
‚ÄúThere are so many kinds of stupidity, and cleverness is one of the worst.‚Äù Thomas Mann. Many words have been expended on the nature of intelligence, while the topic of stupidity is comparatively neglected - even though it is all around us, screwing us up. That‚Äôs probably because we assume stupidity is just a lack of intelligence. I think there‚Äôs more to it than that. It comes in many different forms; what follows is by no means comprehensive‚Ä¶

URL: https://ianleslie.substack.com/p/seven-varieties-of-stupidity?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: It looks like we're headed for a soft landing
item.description:
A couple of weeks ago, I wrote a post envisioning a future where interest rates go to 8%. I made it clear that this was only a possible bad scenario that people should have contingency plans for, not a forecast that people should expect to come true. In fact, I think the most‚Ä¶

item.title: No Housing Please, We're a Community
item.description:
I received a really interesting, insightful comment on a subscribers-only piece from a few weeks ago, on the tension between community and continuity on the one hand, and development and growth on the other. I had mentioned in passing the right-wing meme ‚ÄúI will not live in a pod,‚Äù which refers to the supposed notion that liberals want to cram everyone i‚Ä¶

URL: https://thedeletedscenes.substack.com/p/no-housing-thank-you-were-a-community?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
